thread.title: Hollywood hotshot might be all punched out after months of anti-Trump vitriol: ‘I think I’m broken’
thread.title_full: Hollywood hotshot might be all punched out after months of anti-Trump vitriol: ‘I think I’m broken’

author: Dave Urbanski
title: Hollywood hotshot might be all punched out after months of anti-Trump vitriol: ‘I think I’m broken’
text:
Tweet 
If you’ve ever checked out the Twitter trail of “Avengers” director Joss Whedon, you might conclude he doubles as a Democratic attack man. 
Because for a number of months, Whedon has been launching assault after assault against Donald Trump — during his campaign , after the presidential election and since the Republican took the oath of office last month. 
But could that all be ending? Perhaps just for a short spell, even? 
Whedon on Tuesday offered this confessional tweet, saying, “I think I’m broken”: I think I'm broken 
I never ran smooth but I think I'm really broken, I'm sorry, I was funny for a while, good times, please keep fighting 
— Joss Whedon (@joss) February 7, 2017 
He added that, “I never ran smooth but I think I’m really broken, I’m sorry, I was funny for a while, good times, please keep fighting.” 
Now, Whedon doesn’t specifically say what apparently has got him down, but a number of concerned Twitter users picked up the vibe that he’s throwing in the progressive political towel over Trump dismantling Obama strongholds at a breakneck pace: Your religion is politics, @joss . That's why you're constantly distraught and angry. You're putting your trust in mere mortals. 
— Alo Konsen (@OhioCoastie) February 7, 2017 @joss Don't stop. Your voice is needed. Take time to recharge, but please don't stop.
